##SARS survivor, invisible scars

Wechat media-fox

Features, for those who insist on serious reading options. Sohu News Extreme Day studio.

Editor's Note: At the beginning of 2003, the SARS outbreak that started in southern China left many fearful memories in people's hearts. Six months later, the epidemic was gradually contained, out of control of the situation began to turn, but the trauma did not end with the disaster far away.

Because the hormone class medicine is used massively in the rescue process, after a part of SARS patient is cured, suffers from the disease and so on femoral head necrosis, pulmonary fibrosis, depression. After several media visits, back to infected with the SARS virus survivors. A group of photographs by photographer Zheng Pingping recorded the living conditions of eight families.
In front of these photos, it's hard to say exactly what the trauma is. It could be three or four steps you can't climb. It could be seven years of lost love. It could be a family breakup. Their shadows or silhouettes make people sad, do not want to face the camera face, must have experienced too much separation of life and death of tension and anxiety.

It's not just the fate of eight families. They also left the message that it wasn't the end of a plague, that the problem was solved, that every ordinary human life was shared.

In May 2013, Dong Wei, a nurse returning from maternity leave, suckled her baby in a changing room at a hospital in Beijing. Ten years ago, Dong Wei in the emergency room rescue patients infected with SARS, was found after the femoral head necrosis, left the clinical.

Editor's Note: At the beginning of 2003, the SARS outbreak that started in southern China left many fearful memories in people's hearts. Six months later, the epidemic was gradually contained, out of control of the situation began to turn, but the trauma did not end with the disaster far away.

It's not just the fate of eight families. They also left the message that it wasn't the end of a plague, that the problem was solved, that every ordinary human life was shared.

Because the hormone class medicine is used massively in the rescue process, after a part of SARS patient is cured, suffers from the disease and so on femoral head necrosis, pulmonary fibrosis, depression. After several media visits, back to infected with the SARS virus survivors. A group of photographs by photographer Zheng Pingping recorded the living conditions of eight families.

In front of these photos, it's hard to say exactly what the trauma is. It could be three or four steps you can't climb. It could be seven years of lost love. It could be a family breakup. Their shadows or silhouettes make people sad, do not want to face the camera face, must have experienced too much separation of life and death of tension and anxiety.

It's not just the fate of eight families. They also left the message that it wasn't the end of a plague, that the problem was solved, that every ordinary human life was shared.

In May 2013, Dong Wei, a nurse returning from maternity leave, suckled her baby in a changing room at a hospital in Beijing. Ten years ago, Dong Wei in the emergency room rescue patients infected with SARS, was found after the femoral head necrosis, left the clinical.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Photo and caption by Zheng Ping

Editor Tao Ruogu

This article is authored by the author. The original article appeared in the China Youth Daily in 2005,2006, and 2013, and in China Newsweek in 2003 and 2013.

I can't remember much about the year of SARS.

Dr. Song, like me, rarely recalls what academician Zhong Nanshan called "a war without gunpowder" . She didn't even realize how many years had passed since SARS.

In the late Spring and early summer of 2003, Dr. Song and I spent nearly half a month together in the SARS ward of Beijing Chest Hospital. I even joked that, relative to the SARS virus hidden in a corner outside, the ward with her side is the safest.

Born in the late 1950s, Dr Song was under 20 when he was a doctor, having suffered floods, earthquakes and cholera. SARS hit, the formation of the first batch of anti-sars medical team, she signed up. She said she wasn't scared, because that's what doctors do.

And I was really scared.

On March 27,2003, the World Health Organization declared Beijing an epidemic area for the first time, and like most people, I didn't realize how close the danger was. The real turning point came on April 20, when the State Council, China's cabinet, announced at a news conference that 339 cases had been reported in Atypical pneumonia, up from 37 five days earlier. It was a signed letter from a military doctor at the 301 Military Hospital that made the truth known to the public.

In May 2003, a confirmed case was found in the dormitory of a factory in Beijing.

The letter said he knew of 60 SARS patients in 309 hospitals alone and that six had died by April 3..

Panic began to spread, 23,24, there are concentrated panic buying of household goods phenomenon. I got nervous, went out to put on a mask, came back and washed my hands again and again.

The truth of the public for the media, is another signal.

With the audacity of the ignorant, I entered the heart of SARS. Follow the doctor on duty during rounds every day, take pictures of the work of the staff, chat with the patients briefly, and take photos after getting permission. I was just starting out, and all I got was a WYSIWYG moment. And the face of such a disaster, really let me think it will bring us the change is the emergence of SARS sequelae patients.

Two years later,

In November 2003, the front page of southern weekend ran a photo of hospital staff treating SARS in a hyperbaric oxygen chamber through a "Cat's eye" on the door of a high-pressure chamber. This is the first time I heard of "SARS sequelae. ". Until exactly two years later, I rode the bus for several hours with Xu Mei, a reporter for a weekly magazine, to a private hospital on the outskirts of Beijing, and met Liu Yuan, he was diagnosed as suffering from the SARS sequelae of bilateral osteonecrosis of the FEMORAL head -- a group he only really came into contact with at the time.

Liu Yuan, 40-year-old, more than two years after the SARS, suddenly felt pain in the left inner leg, was found femoral head necrosis. He is in charge of the production manager, Liu Yuan said in silence for a long time: "What's the use of worrying, take your time! " His calm, oppression, stung me, the original SARS did not end.

In June 2005, the Beijing Municipal Bureau of Health issued the implementation rules for the work of people infected with SARS complicated with sequelae, providing free medical care for sequelae patients. By 2013, nearly 160 non-work-related infections had entered the list of free treatment. In addition, according to the SARS Sequelae Treatment Designated Hospital Wangjing Hospital Professor Chen Weiheng introduced, only he knew about 140 people infected with SARS sequelae.

In May 2003, doctors returning to the SARS ward of Beijing Chest Hospital took off their protective clothing under the guidance of staff from the transitional area.

In 2005, information about the "POST-SARS" stage and SARS sequelae patients was scarce in the media. I consulted several doctors who had worked on the front line, and they confirmed that some "life-saving measures" at that time did have the possibility of sequelae such as osteonecrosis of the femoral head, but no official statement was made.

I had to soak in the suburbs of a few so-called treatment of osteonecrosis of the femoral head Specialist Hospital, every day get sporadic news. It's not uncommon for doors to be closed. Even if find sequela sufferer, hear to want to appeal to media, a lot of people flinch. They are sensitive and repetitive, because they worry about the people around them looking at them differently and worrying about their family being disturbed.

That's when I met Dong Wei. The first time I saw her in the hallway of the emergency room, she was walking carefully among her hurried colleagues. She was thin, looking empty in her sky blue nurse's uniform. That's where she resumed work on December 1,2005.

Dong Wei can only work half-day, from 8:00 to 11:00. In order to take care of her, the hospital also specially in this post additional personnel. Colleagues are always rushing to do, so most of the time, Dong Wei is leaning on the console watching, pass something stamp. Even so, back home, Dong Wei or feel very tired, what do not want to do, eight or nine o'clock in the evening must go to bed.

In a month, it'll be back to eight-hour days. Dong Wei began to consider changing of the guard: "which nurse in the emergency department doesn't walk fast? I'm lucky if I can walk steadily. " For this, originally planning to study nursing specialty, Dong Wei changed her specialty to medical information management, she hopes to stay in the hospital, "do a librarian. ".

In May 2013, a photograph of Dong, who had just had a bone graft, was plastered on her locker. She thought she would be disabled forever.

In April 2003, she was infected after receiving a fever patient who had concealed a history of exposure to SARS. After discharge, Dong Wei put a fluke, until was diagnosed as the right femoral head necrosis, she realized, waiting for his life may be disabled. Until now, she thought it was decalcification.

"When I was infected with SARS, I died once and for all. I had necrosis of the thigh. Even if I didn't use crutches, I was still a disabled person, " Dong Wei said. For a fun-loving girl, this means that after work and colleagues can not go shopping, playing, singing, hiking can only become a dream.

Not only that, she lost seven years of love. Just confirmed the stock necrosis, Dong Wei formally to the boyfriend to break up, told him he is no longer a "normal person" , and all the possible family, fertility problems to him. The boyfriend was adamant. He didn't agree. Dong Wei lucky, met a good man, peace of mind treatment. It didn't take long for the boyfriend to break up because his parents objected to the idea that their future daughter-in-law was someone who needed to be looked after for life. Unprepared Dong Wei cried, she said hate boyfriend is too cowardly.

At the end of 2005, while the medical community was still entangled in the relationship between SARS virus, hormones and necrosis, hundreds of SARS patients in Beijing were suffering from body, emotion and family changes in silence.

"At that time Dong Wei's mood is very bad, soon left here, this matter also very big to us. " Dong Wei once treated in the hospital ward, Liu Mei said also cried. She said, not only for Dong Wei, a think of these two years, there will be too much injustice and helplessness.

SARS recovered, Liu Mei also did not think, necrosis in her eyes is "impossible thing. ". The third month of work, the pain more and more frequent, Liu Mei was diagnosed as bilateral thigh necrosis. "there was no group therapy, " he said. "I felt lost as I went from hospital to hospital. "

In March 2005, she had a bone graft. Three months after the operation, the doctor told her she was doing well enough to abandon her abduction. But three months later, I was told that the results were not good, so to speak, YTHT said. The willow eyebrow is stunned: "This sentence is a A Bolt from the Blue to me. "

In April 2003, medical staff and family members of a hospital in Beijing were called in to bid farewell.

The ups and downs of the past two years have made the already slender, introverted eyebrows more cautious, too worried about the future. For example, work, which unit will raise a what can not do employee? "A lot of these inconveniences are hard to put into words, and they're not what normal people experience, and I'm starting to feel them, too. I'm worried now that if I go back to work at the hospital, the three or four steps I walk in the door are going to be a problem. I don't know what to do. I Hope Society doesn't forget us."

Compared with these young people who have no family, Liu Yuan, who is in his early 40s, "has no time" to despair. "I have a family, a daughter and an employee. ". On December 10,2005, after the first treatment, Liu Yuan packed his things and waited for his family to pick him up. On his hand was a list of the expenses for the 10-day treatment, excluding the purchase of more than 2,900 yuan for physiotherapy equipment and more than 4,000 yuan for various treatments, "Such a large amount of expenses in the future how reimbursement, but also with the company to renegotiate. ".

According to the hospital, a course of treatment should be three months, 10 days of treatment for his illness does not make sense, but as the production manager, he can not leave his job, want to busy end of the year, after the Spring Festival to come to the hospital serious treatment. But in a highly competitive society, Liu doesn't want to think about whether leaving would mean permanent loss.

Whether it is Liu Yuan's career, or Dong Wei's marriage, all the problems are almost SARS patients after life copy. Two years is just a small part of a long journey.

Three years later,

In May 2006, in a bungalow not far from the Dongzhimen Hospital in Beijing, she sat quietly with her eyes closed. This is a self-built house, crowded in the alley, put down a double bed, a single bed and a desk, only half a meter of the aisle. In order to cure the disease, two years ago, Zhang Jinping and her family moved here from the building.

In May 2003, out of the SARS ward of Zhang Jinping, every day to the street, the park around, always feel not enough in front of a tree and grass. The silent husband changes the pattern to cook delicious food for the whole family, the daughter that just works put the new photograph of art to hang on the wall, the life returns to before, poor but tasty.

In 2005, in a hospital on the outskirts of Beijing, medical workers suffering from the aftermath of SARS received intensive rehabilitation treatment

Half a year later, Zhang Jinping appeared one after another dry eyes, femoral head necrosis, cerebral infarction and other symptoms, all over the body every minute of the pain devouring her, the treatment of hardship and hopelessness let her attempt to die to release. At this time, the family again, the mother-in-law needed surgery for a heart attack, twenty-something daughter brain tumor surgery after falling Hemiplegia. Looking at a white-headed husband, had every day to tears Zhang Jinping Leng is not crying, also do not mention the suicide. But she "never gave up on the idea, " and behind her family's back, she saved a whole bottle of sleeping pills: "My eyes are getting blurry and I can't see. I'll leave on the day I can't see, and I can't drag Lao Yang (husband) down any more. ".

Zhang broke off all contact and let the phone ring at home. "I don't like to see my former colleagues and friends, looking at them all living better than me, I feel aggrieved. How can a strong person be like this? " She also keeps a distance from her patients, "other people don't have as many problems as I do, and it makes me feel uncomfortable to see them recover well. " In her own world, Zhang Jinping is left with this small room. Occasionally, in good spirits, she would change the sheets with a pair of crutches, wipe the table, and more often, she would close her eyes and think over and over, "if I had not been hospitalized, I would not have contracted SARS; if I had... "

"The doctor said my pain was partly psychological, and I had free counseling, which didn't help. " The desperation made Zhang even more vulnerable. Speaking of the past two years, her husband looked away, not letting a tear fall. "I know he must have cried behind my back. I don't want to be pessimistic all the time, but I can't laugh. No one in this family has laughed in a long time. "

For Fang Bo, 54, the home is an empty room full of misery.

Fang Bo, later appeared in almost every report on the sequelae of SARS. In 2003, Fang Bo family 9 people were infected, his wife did not survive. After discharge from the hospital, heard that his serum can treat SARS, Fang Bo led the Python 7 people to donate serum. Unexpectedly half a year later, oneself and two son-in-law successively check out FEMUR head necrosis, successive blow makes everybody in the home become extremely sensitive, irritable, between father and daughter, husband and wife, between father-in-law and son-in-law, "can quarrel all" . Then the two daughters divorced their husbands. The whole family's gone.

Lao Fang and his patients with SARS sequelae have been collecting data to fight for their own rights and interests.

Lao Fang Hid in the hospital and stayed there for two years. Even though it was a holiday, he didn't want to go back to the empty house. In February 2006, Lao Fang had a second replacement operation. "other people's surgeries are all signed by their families. I have to sign my own surgeries. "

May 16 is Lao Fang's 54th birthday. Early in the morning, has abandoned the old side lame sweep, mopping, sweaty to clean up the house again. The good health of the old party mood a lot of comfort, "I hope to be happy up. ". At noon, his friend gave him his birthday, the words accidentally touched the past, the atmosphere suddenly solidified. "We try to be happy and try to distract ourselves, but it's a web we can't escape. My anger is buried deep in my heart. I won't say it, but it won't go away. ".

In 2003, Fang Bo made the decision to donate his body after he was discharged from hospital.

After the report on SARS sequelae was published, readers Liu Mei called, she let me see more SARS "big event" covered by the imprint of scars.

Liu Mei's husband, Lao Wang, also suffered from SARS. On January 18,2004, Liu Mei remembered the date vividly. It was a windy day, and she covered up the shock, patting him on the shoulder and saying, "it's okay, I'll push you. ".

From that day on, old Wang was like a different person, and his life was in chaos. He's a brilliant man, early 40s, always doing well at work. The sudden diagnosis destroyed the hope of life, and he struggled to maintain his self-esteem as a man. "I don't want to walk around in front of strangers on crutches. I'm in so much pain that I only use a small cane. I can't carry a heavy load when I go shopping with my lover, so I have to walk around empty-handed. I don't know whether to sit or not on the bus when there's a girl to sit on. "

"these subtle psychological factors are difficult for normal people to understand, " said Wang. In order to help her husband, Liu Mei is on the move. But her pains did not gain her husband's understanding, and he refused to even speak to her. "I know his heart is bitter, encounter such thing, I also grievance. " For her, as long as there is a little bit better, it is worth holding on to. But her husband's coldness, the mood of inconstancy, will douse her enthusiasm bit by bit.

Life is slow and heavy. One cold morning in 2006, Liu Mei pushed open the window and felt nothing but a blur. She knew that the wound would get bigger and bigger, and she would never have the strength to heal her husband. On April 4th, they divorced. Standing on the road, Liu Mei remembered three years ago when the first proposed divorce, Lao Wang did not say anything, ran to the market to buy a few pounds of meat, Liu Mei favorite to eat bacon.

After the divorce, Liu Mei did not leave the "home" , still take care of old Wang, cooking, medicine, accompany the doctor. In a few days, when he gets better, I'll go. Liu Mei remembered to old Wang said, she broke her promise, the pain like a knife carved in the heart. If it hadn't been for SARS, she said, divorce would have been a relief, not as painful as it is now.

Old Wang also once deep remorse: In fact, I was not aimed at her, but I have anger in the heart, can not control, can only cast on her body. It's all in the mind.

Sensitivity, depression, anxiety, paranoia are almost the general emotions of SARS patients. The repeated treatment, the embarrassment of life, the pressure of the environment, constantly reminds them that their original life is completely destroyed. Now that psychotherapy is finally covered by health insurance, it's hard to see how they can solve all the real problems that come with it.

Ten years later,

Some women have managed to get their lives back on track, gain love and become mothers, but they still face the risk of femoral head collapse and disability during pregnancy. At the same time, some women who have recovered from SARS have serious endocrine disorders, the word "sterilization" was once used in this group. For these young mothers, the pain is accompanied by embarrassment and loneliness at home and in society.

On March 29,2003, Li Gang, the husband of Xinyao, was admitted to Youan Hospital in Beijing with a sudden high fever while caring for his father, who was suffering from uremia. The rural family on the outskirts of Beijing was nearly wiped out, and new Yao, his mother-in-law and his father-in-law, who were more than six months pregnant, were diagnosed with SARS.

In May 2013, after dinner, her son, who was in primary school, looked through the curtain into the back room, where she was massaging her husband. New Yao has been massaging her husband every day for nine years since he was diagnosed with 10 major joint necrosis in his legs.

At that time, the 22-year-old new Yao also fantasized about keeping the baby inside, and she worked out by clinging to the edge of the bed. But before she left the hospital, doctors advised her to remove the baby, and new Yao performed an induced labor operation without telling her yet-to-be-discharged husband. New Yao said she would never forget that day.

Due to mental stimulation, new Yao fell into a seizure problem, and therefore lost his job. Originally do not want to be born again, in order to get sick old man still agreed, discharge half a year, she was pregnant again. However, her husband was found to have a bad joint in his leg. Li Gang, a long-distance transport worker, worked harder to earn enough milk powder for the baby before he became paralyzed.

The baby was born safe. But because of fatigue, from the second stage of collapse to the fourth stage of Li Gang had to undergo femoral head replacement surgery. It was the hardest day for the family. The car was sold, the TV was sold, the refrigerator was sold, and finally new Yao sold his wedding gold jewelry. The family, which had been farming the land for a living, was living on his father's retirement salary of three thousand Renminbi a month.

In 2008, the Beijing Red Cross Society began to give people with SARS a hardship allowance of 4,000 yuan per year for those with jobs and 8,000 yuan per year for those without jobs. In 2012, the amount of the allowance was raised to 4,500 yuan and 9,000 yuan respectively.

Husbands and mothers-in-law can each receive more than 700 yuan a month. New Yao is not on this list. According to regulations, only three kinds of diseases, such as osteonecrosis of the femoral head, pulmonary fibrosis and depression, are eligible for the government's medical relief and exemption policy. Other diseases, such as osteoporosis and blood diseases, which are common in SARS sequelae groups, are not covered by the relief and exemption.

Most of the family money was spent on a family of four. New Yao said she "can never turn the page on SARS" , but she believes "as long as the brain is not stupid, always find a way to live. ". She thought of setting up a clothing stall when she got better, which was also her dream when she was young.

Xinyao chats with her husband and son on the Kang after dinner in May 2013.

Chang Jing was one of the first patients to be infected with SARS in Beijing. At that time, the hospital did not have enough knowledge about SARS. Shortly after discharge from hospital, often Jing feel leg pain, examination results is necrosis of the femoral head. She thinks she's young and she can always be cured.

Her boyfriend's mother, worried that the disease might maim or even affect fertility, was clearly opposed to the relationship, and the conflict continued after marriage. Chang Jing hopes to get pregnant soon, how much is also to prove to the family, his body is no problem. To this end, she secretly took four or five years to treat the SARS sequelae of drugs stopped, also did not tell the hospital maternity examination, a person in fear for 10 months. Her desire for the child outweighed her concern about the effects of stopping the drug.

But the hard part is just beginning. After the birth of the child, the secondary collapse of the FEMORAL head has been unable to load the child's pressure, often can only sit holding the child quietly. As the child grows up, Chang Jing can not run and jump with the child. In kindergarten, she blamed herself for failing her children's physical tests. Whenever the child begged to hug, petite she will meet him gritted her teeth, can not walk 10 meters, and two legs weak.

In May 2013, my son was given a quiet hug.

The unwitting mother-in-law always called her "delicate" . Often quietly endure pain to do housework, she is afraid of her mother-in-law know, but also forced them to separate. She was even more afraid to tell her mother-in-law that she had lost her job. Hospital treatment, which is also referred to as work, forced her to live in a world of lies.

School of design origin Chang Jing still hope to find a competent job, in the unstable marriage, give yourself a little hope, let yourself stand on your own feet. But such jobs are not easy to find, can not be too far from home, can not stand for long periods of time, and can not be sedentary.

During this decade, from the government's recognition of the existence of SARS survivors, to the creation of a health care list that included more than 150 SARS survivors, and the granting of what patients call the "728 program, " Governments are gradually solving practical problems for this group, and it is through their own efforts that the truth becomes more widely known to the government and the public.

In 2013, Fang Bo and his fellow patients opened microblogs, calling for the establishment of a SARS relief fund through "Self-media" .

When she remarried in December 2009, the petite Liu Mei snuggled up to her American husband and smiled beautifully for the camera. On this day, the patients in Wangjing Hospital, for Liu Mei held a small celebration ceremony. The first time, they laughed so hard they cried in front of my camera.

In December 2009, Liu Mei and her husband brought newlywed candy to a patient undergoing rehabilitation at Wangjing Hospital in Beijing.

November 1,2012, Dong Wei sent a text message, I gave birth to Darling, in-laws sitting in confinement. In that moment, I truly felt their pain and laughter, not a part of the story.

In Dong Wei's home, SARS is also a topic that must be carefully circumvented. Her later marriage was also opposed by her in-laws for physical reasons, and her lover was even prepared to break off relations with the family. It was not until the birth of the child that her estrangement from her in-laws eased somewhat.

As a medical staff, Dong Wei gradually calm down from the initial panic and despair, for most people worry about hormone problems, she felt: "Six months after the withdrawal should be almost metabolic. ". And even if it did, she said she was okay with it.

Dong Wei returned to the hospital, by the Unit, colleagues care, left the line, but it also means that "this life may also be a chore. ". Life goes on, she goes shopping with her girlfriends, takes trips with her family, and starts rediscovering the world with darling.

Ten years later, looking back on the road, Dong Wei said there is pain, more is the experience. "It's important to have more experience in life, to be less Pale and vulnerable. ". "No matter how hard it is, I can see tomorrow, " said Dong, who is putting on her high heels again

(to protect the privacy of the interviewees, all the characters in the article are pseudonyms except Zhang Jinping and Fang Bo.)
